chapter.title: The Specialized C API for PLplot
chapter.para: The purpose of this chapter is to document the PLPlot C functions that are currently not part of the common API, either because they are C/C++ specific utility functions (e.g. &plAlloc2dGrid;, &plFree2dGrid;) or because they are not easily implemented in other languages (e.g. &plGetCursor;). Some of these functions are used in the examples and may be helpful for other users of plplot.
This chapter also documents some of the data types and structures defined by plplot and used by the functions.

sect1.title: plabort: Error abort
sect1.para: This routine is to be used when something goes wrong that doesn't require calling &plexit; but for which there is no useful recovery. It calls the abort handler defined via &plsabort;, does some cleanup and returns. The user can supply his/her own abort handler and pass it in via &plsabort;.
This function is currently available in C, f77, f95 and python.
This function is used in example 20.

sect1.title: plAlloc2dGrid: Allocate a block of memory for use as a 2-d grid of type PLFLT.
sect1.para: Allocates a block of memory for use as a 2-d grid of type PLFLT. The grid is a vectored 2-d C-style array and so can be accessed using syntax like *f[i][j]. The memory associated with the grid must be freed by calling &plFree2dGrid; once it is no longer required.

listitem.para: Pointer to a PLFLT grid. On success f will point to a pointer to the vectored 2-d array of type PLFLT. If the allocation fails f will be NULL.
Dimensions of grid to be allocated.

sect1.para: This function is currently available in C, C++, perl and tk.
This function is used in examples 8, 9, 11, 14, 16, 20, 21, 22, 28, 30.

sect1.title: plClearOpts: Clear internal option table info structure.
sect1.para: Clear the internal options table info structure. This removes any option added with &plMergeOpts; as well as all default entries.
This function returns 0 on success.
This function is currently available in C, C++ and Ocaml.
This function is not used in any examples.

sect1.title: plexit: Error exit
sect1.para: This routine is called in case an error is encountered during execution of a PLplot routine. It prints the error message, tries to release allocated resources, calls the handler provided by &plsexit; and then exits. If cleanup needs to be done in the driver program then the user may want to supply his/her own exit handler and pass it in via &plsexit;. This function should either call &plend; before exiting, or simply return.
This function is currently available in C and ada.
This function is not used in any examples.

sect1.title: plFree2dGrid: Free the memory associated with a 2-d grid allocated using &plAlloc2dGrid;.
sect1.para: Frees a block of memory allocated using &plAlloc2dGrid;.

listitem.para: Dimensions of grid to be freed.

sect1.para: This function is currently available in C, C++, perl and tk.
This function is used in examples 8, 9, 11, 14, 16, 20, 21, 22, 28, 30.

sect1.title: plGetCursor: Wait for graphics input event and translate to world coordinates.
sect1.para: Wait for graphics input event and translate to world coordinates. Returns 0 if no translation to world coordinates is possible.

listitem.para: Pointer to &PLGraphicsIn; structure which will contain the output. The structure is not allocated by the routine and must exist before the function is called.

sect1.para: This function returns 1 on success and 0 if no translation to world coordinates is possible.
This function is currently only available with the C, C++, Ocaml, Octave, Perl, Python and Ada language bindings.
This function is used in examples 1 and 20.

sect1.title: plgfile: Get output file handle
sect1.para: Gets the current output file handle, if applicable.

listitem.para: File pointer to current output file.

sect1.para: This function is currently available in C, C++ and Ocaml.
This function is not used in any examples.

sect1.title: plMergeOpts: Merge use option table into internal info structure.
sect1.para: Merges in a set of user supplied command line options with the internal options table. This allows use options to be used along with the built-in plplot options to set device driver, output file etc. See &plparseopts; for details of how to parse these options in a program.

listitem.para: Label to preface the options in the program help.
A null-terminated array of notes which appear after the options in the program help.

sect1.para: This function is currently available in C, C++ and Ocaml.
This function is used in examples 1, 8, 16, 20 and 21.

sect1.title: plMinMax2dGrid: Find the minimum and maximum of a 2d grid allocated using &plAlloc2dGrid;.
sect1.para: Find the minimum and maximum of a 2d grid allocated using &plAlloc2dGrid;.

listitem.para: PLFLT grid to find the maximum / minimum of.
Maximum and minimum values in the grid f.

sect1.para: This function is currently available in C, C++, Java, Ocaml and Python.
This function is used in examples 8, 11, 20 and 21.

sect1.title: plOptUsage: Print usage and syntax message.
sect1.para: Prints the usage and syntax message. The message can also be display using the -h command line option. There is a default message describing the default plplot options. The usage message is also modified by &plSetUsage; and &plMergeOpts;.

listitem.para: String to appear as the name of program.
String to appear as the usage text.

sect1.para: This function is currently available in C, C++, Java, Ocaml, Octave and Python.
This function is not used in any examples.

sect1.title: plMergeOpts: Reset internal option table info structure.
sect1.para: Resets the internal command line options table to the default builtin value. Any user options added with &plMergeOpts; will be cleared. See &plparseopts; for details of how to parse these options in a program.
This function is currently available in C, C++, Java, Ocaml and Octave, although it is not much use in Java or Octave since they don't have plMergeOpts.
This function is not used in any examples.

sect1.title: plsabort: Set abort handler
sect1.para: Sets an optional user abort handler. See &plabort; for details.
This function is currently available in C and Ocaml.
This function is not used in any examples.

sect1.title: plSetUsage: Set the strings used in usage and syntax messages.
sect1.para: Sets the program string and usage string displayed by the command line help option (-h) and by &plOptUsage;.

listitem.para: String to appear as the name of program.
String to appear as the usage text.

sect1.para: This function is currently available in C, C++, Java, Ocaml, Octave and Python.
This function is not used in any examples.

sect1.title: plsexit: Set exit handler
sect1.para: Sets an optional user exit handler. See &plexit; for details.
This function is currently available in C, C++ and Ocaml.
This function is not used in any examples.

sect1.title: plsfile: Set output file handle
sect1.para: Sets the current output file handle, if applicable. If the file has has not been previously opened and is required by the driver, the user will be prompted for the file name. This routine, if used, must be called before initializing PLplot.

listitem.para: File pointer. The type (i.e. text or binary) doesn't matter on *ix systems. On systems where it might matter it should match the type of file that the output driver would produce, i.e. text for the postscript driver.

sect1.para: This function is currently available in C, C++ and Ocaml.
This function is not used in any examples.
